00049  *
00050  *      File :          l_pipe_rename.c
00051  *      Description :   Rename disjoint virtual register lifetimes
00052  *                      have the same virtual register id within loop
00053  *      Creation Date : January 26, 1997
00054  *      Author :        Daniel Lavery, based on code by Richard Hank
00055  *
00056  *      Revision Date: Summer 1999
00057  *      Authors: IMPACT Technologies: Matthew Merten and John Gyllenhaal
00058  *

00076 typedef struct _LpipeLiveRange {
00077   short id;
00078   short vreg;
00079   short valid;
00080   short ctype;
00081   L_Oper *def_oper;
00082   Set op;
00083   Set def_op;
00084   Set ref_op;
00085   Set live_out_op;
00086 } LpipeLiveRange;
00087 
00088 static LpipeLiveRange **LpipeLiveRanges;
00089 static int numLpipeLiveRange;
00090

00092                 Function Definitions

00098                 Utility Function Definitions

00100 
00101 void
00102 R_print_LpipeLiveRange (LpipeLiveRange * lr)
00103 {
00104   fprintf (stdout, "***\nvreg           %d\n", lr->vreg);
00105   fprintf (stdout, "def_oper            %d\n", lr->def_oper->id);
00106   Set_print (stdout, "def_op", lr->def_op);
00107   Set_print (stdout, "ref_op", lr->ref_op);
00108   Set_print (stdout, "live_out_op", lr->live_out_op);
00109   Set_print (stdout, "op", lr->op);
00110 }
00111 
00112 /*************************************************************************
00113                 Function Definitions
00114 *************************************************************************/
00115 
00116 static void
00117 Lpipe_create_rename_comp_code_block (L_Func * fn, L_Cb * pipe_cb,
00118                                      L_Oper * exit_branch)
00119 {
00120   L_Flow *exit_flow;
00121   L_Cb *exit_cb, *comp_cb;
00122   L_Attr *attr;
00123   L_Oper *new_oper;
00124 
00125   exit_flow = L_find_flow_for_branch (pipe_cb, exit_branch);
00126   exit_cb = exit_flow->dst_cb;
00127 
00128   if (L_single_predecessor_cb (exit_cb))
00129     return;
00130 
00131   comp_cb = L_split_arc (fn, pipe_cb, exit_flow);
00132 
00133   attr = L_new_attr ("rename_comp_code", 0);
00134   comp_cb->attr = L_concat_attr (comp_cb->attr, attr);
00135 
00136   if ((new_oper = comp_cb->first_op))
00137     {
00138       L_annotate_oper (fn, comp_cb, new_oper);
00139       L_delete_oper (comp_cb, new_oper);
00140     }
00141 
00142   return;
00143 }
00144 
00145 /*
00146  * Lpipe_create_comp_code_blocks
00147  * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00148  * Ensure that each of the loop's outgoing arcs terminates at a
00149  * single-predecessor block suitable for receiving compensation code.
00150  */
00151 void
00152 Lpipe_create_comp_code_blocks (L_Func * fn, L_Inner_Loop * loop)
00153 {
00154   L_Cb *pipe_cb;
00155   L_Oper *oper, *loop_back_br;
00156   L_Flow *last_flow;
00157 
00158   pipe_cb = loop->cb;
00159   loop_back_br = loop->feedback_op;
00160 
00161   for (oper = pipe_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
00162     if ((L_cond_branch (oper)) && (oper != loop_back_br))
00163       Lpipe_create_rename_comp_code_block (fn, pipe_cb, oper);
00164 
00165   /* Create one for the fallthrough path also --- since the RIN set
00166    * of this successor block is used to find the ROUT/ft set of the
00167    * loopback branch, the successor had better not have any other
00168    * predecessors in the loop!
00169    */
00170 
00171   if ((last_flow = L_find_last_flow (pipe_cb->dest_flow)) &&
00172       (last_flow->dst_cb == pipe_cb->next_cb) && 
00173       !L_single_predecessor_cb (pipe_cb->next_cb))
00174     L_split_arc (fn, pipe_cb, last_flow);
00175 
00176   return;
00177 }
00178 
00179 static void
00180 Lpipe_rename_mac (L_Func *fn, L_Operand *mopd, L_Inner_Loop *inl)
00181 {
00182   L_Cb *cb = inl->cb;
00183   L_Oper *op;
00184   L_Operand *opd, *ropd;
00185   L_Flow *fl;
00186   int mac = mopd->value.mac,  rval = ++(fn->max_reg_id), i;
00187 
00188   mopd = L_copy_operand (mopd);
00189   ropd = L_copy_operand (mopd);
00190   ropd->type = L_OPERAND_REGISTER;
00191   ropd->value.r = rval;
00192 
00193   for (op = cb->first_op; op; op = op->next_op)
00194     {
00195       for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
00196         {
00197           if (!(opd = op->dest[i]) || !L_is_macro (opd) || 
00198               (opd->value.mac != mac))
00199             continue;
00200 
00201           opd->type = L_OPERAND_REGISTER;
00202           opd->value.r = rval;
00203         }
00204       for (i = 0; i < L_max_src_operand; i++)
00205         {
00206           if (!(opd = op->src[i]) || !L_is_macro (opd) || 
00207               (opd->value.mac != mac))
00208             continue;
00209 
00210           opd->type = L_OPERAND_REGISTER;
00211           opd->value.r = rval;
00212         }
00213     }
00214 
00215   for (fl = cb->dest_flow; fl; fl = fl->next_flow)
00216     {
00217       if (fl->dst_cb == cb)
00218         continue;
00219 
00220       op = Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (L_copy_operand (mopd),
00221                                              L_copy_operand (ropd));
00222 
00223       L_insert_oper_before (fl->dst_cb, fl->dst_cb->first_op, op);
00224       L_annotate_oper (fn, fl->dst_cb, op);
00225       L_delete_oper (fl->dst_cb, op);
00226     }
00227 
00228   op = Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (ropd, mopd);
00229   L_insert_oper_after (inl->preheader, inl->preheader->last_op, op);
00230   L_annotate_oper (fn, inl->preheader, op);
00231   L_delete_oper (inl->preheader, op);
00232 
00233   return;
00234 }
00235 
00236 /* 
00237  * Rename all macros explicitly defined in the block (to enable
00238  * subsequent mve/rreg gen, as necessary).  Assumes comp code CBs
00239  * have already been generated.
00240  */
00241 extern int
00242 Lpipe_rename_defined_macros (L_Func *fn, L_Inner_Loop *inl)
00243 {
00244   int cnt, i;
00245   L_Cb *cb = inl->cb;
00246   L_Oper *op;
00247   L_Operand *opd;
00248   Set macs = NULL;
00249 
00250   for (op = cb->first_op; op; op = op->next_op)
00251     {
00252       for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
00253         {
00254           if ((opd = op->dest[i]) && L_is_macro (opd) &&
00255               !L_is_ctype_predicate (opd) &&
00256               !Set_in (macs, opd->value.mac))
00257             {
00258               macs = Set_add (macs, opd->value.mac);
00259               Lpipe_rename_mac (fn, opd, inl);
00260             }
00261         }
00262     }
00263 
00264   if ((cnt = Set_size (macs)))
00265     {
00266       L_warn ("Softpipe renamed %d macros in %s() cb %d",
00267               cnt, fn->name, cb->id);
00268       macs = Set_dispose (macs);      
00269     }
00270   return cnt;
00271 }
00272 
00273 /*
00274  * PROBLEM:
00275  *
00276  * A        r3 = r3
00277  * 1   <pn> r3 = r3 + 1
00278  * 2   ... big dep height
00279  * 3   <pm> jump ----------> r3 live out
00280  * 4   <pn> r3 = r3 + 1
00281  * 5   ... big dep height
00282  * 6   <pm> jump ----------> r3 live out
00283  *   
00284  * Fixing the exposed writes will put a move of r3 into r3 to 
00285  * ensure a complete write (line A).
00286  * However, the write to r3 in line 4 is pinned belwo the
00287  * jump in line 3 due to an anti dependence.
00288  */
00289 
00290 
00291 static int
00292 L_fix_exposed_pred_wrt (L_Func * fn, L_Cb * pipe_cb, int vreg)
00293 {
00294   L_Oper *oper, *new_oper;
00295   int i;
00296   L_Operand *dest, *new_dest, *new_src;
00297 
00298   for (oper = pipe_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
00299     {
00300       for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
00301         {
00302           if (!(dest = oper->dest[i]) ||
00303               !L_is_reg (dest) || 
00304               (L_REG_INDEX (dest->value.r) != vreg))
00305             continue;
00306 
00307           if (L_is_predicated (oper))
00308             {
00309               new_dest = L_new_register_operand (dest->value.r, dest->ctype,
00310                                                  L_PTYPE_NULL);
00311               new_src = L_copy_operand (new_dest);
00312               new_oper = Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (new_dest, new_src);
00313               L_insert_oper_before (pipe_cb, oper, new_oper);
00314               L_annotate_oper (fn, pipe_cb, new_oper);
00315               L_delete_oper (pipe_cb, new_oper);
00316 
00317               if (Lpipe_debug >= 1)
00318                 fprintf (stdout,
00319                          "Fixed infinite live range on r %d before op %d\n",
00320                          L_UNMAP_REG (vreg), oper->id);
00321 
00322               return 1;
00323             }
00324           else
00325             {
00326               return 0;
00327             }
00328         }
00329     }
00330   return 0;
00331 }
00332 
00333 
00334 int
00335 Lpipe_fix_infinite_lifetimes (L_Func * fn, L_Cb * cb)
00336 {
00337   Set in_set;
00338   int *varray, num_live_in, i, change = 0;
00339 
00340   in_set = L_get_cb_IN_set (cb);
00341 
00342   num_live_in = Set_size (in_set);
00343   varray = (int *) alloca (num_live_in * sizeof (int));
00344   Set_2array (in_set, varray);
00345   for (i = 0; i < num_live_in; i++)
00346     change += L_fix_exposed_pred_wrt (fn, cb, varray[i]);
00347 
00348   return change;
00349 }
00350 
00351 
00352 void
00353 Lpipe_rename_disj_vregs_in_loop (L_Func * fn, L_Inner_Loop * loop)
00354 {
00355   int i, j, k, arch, dest, change, cnt = 0;
00356   int *oparray;
00357   LpipeLiveRange **vrarray;
00358   L_Attr *ill_reg;
00359   L_Cb *pipe_cb, *comp_cb;
00360   L_Oper *loop_back_br, *ptr, *oper, *new_oper;
00361 
00362   pipe_cb = loop->cb;
00363   loop_back_br = loop->feedback_op;
00364 
00365   /* Requires up-to-date live variable and reaching definition */
00366 
00367   LpipeLiveRanges = (LpipeLiveRange **) calloc (((fn->max_oper_id + 1) *
00368                                                  L_max_dest_operand),
00369                                                 sizeof (LpipeLiveRange *));
00370 
00371   /*
00372    * Create a live range for each virtual register definition in loop
00373    */
00374   arch = M_arch;
00375   for (oper = pipe_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
00376     {
00377       for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
00378         {
00379           L_Operand *dest = oper->dest[i];
00380           LpipeLiveRange *lr;
00381 
00382           if (!dest || !L_is_reg (dest) || L_is_ctype_predicate (dest))
00383             continue;
00384 
00385           lr = (LpipeLiveRange *) malloc (sizeof (LpipeLiveRange));
00386           lr->valid = 1;
00387           lr->id = oper->id;
00388           lr->vreg = dest->value.r;
00389           lr->ctype = dest->ctype;
00390           lr->def_oper = oper;
00391 
00392           /* This prevents spitting live ranges of the form:      */
00393           /*              r1 <-                                   */
00394           /*              r1 <- r1 + r2                           */
00395           /*                 <- r1                                */
00396           /* Since x86 has a 2 operand format.                    */
00397           /* REH 3/10/95                                          */
00398           /* Also prevent splitting of pre/post ince instr.       */
00399           
00400           /* TI also has 2 operand format.      SYH 9/24/96       */
00401 
00402           if ((arch == M_X86) || (arch == M_TI) ||
00403               L_preincrement_load_opcode (oper) ||
00404               L_postincrement_load_opcode (oper) ||
00405               L_preincrement_store_opcode (oper) ||
00406               L_postincrement_store_opcode (oper) ||
00407               L_bit_deposit_opcode (oper) ||
00408               L_find_attr (oper->attr, "do_not_split"))
00409             lr->op = Set_add (NULL, oper->id);
00410           else
00411             lr->op = NULL;
00412 
00413           lr->def_op = Set_add (NULL, oper->id);
00414           lr->ref_op = NULL;
00415           lr->live_out_op = NULL;
00416           LpipeLiveRanges[cnt++] = lr;
00417         }
00418     }
00419   numLpipeLiveRange = cnt;
00420 
00421   /* For each reaching definition IN set for each oper in loop, remove
00422      reaching definitions that lexically follow the oper in the loop,
00423      but do not reach the loop back branch.  These reaching defs must
00424      be live out of at least one of the early exits, and can be renamed
00425      in the compensation code blocks.  For each oper, find lexically later
00426      definitions by searching forward in cb.  Remove definition if it is in
00427      the IN set of oper and not in the IN set of loop back branch. */
00428 
00429   for (oper = pipe_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
00430     {
00431       for (ptr = oper; ptr; ptr = ptr->next_op)
00432         {
00433           for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
00434             {
00435               L_Operand *dest = ptr->dest[i];
00436 
00437               if (!dest || !L_is_reg (dest) || L_is_ctype_predicate (dest))
00438                 continue;
00439 
00440               /* exclude defs we don't want to rename */
00441               if (L_preincrement_load_opcode (ptr) ||
00442                   L_postincrement_load_opcode (ptr) ||
00443                   L_preincrement_store_opcode (ptr) ||
00444                   L_postincrement_store_opcode (ptr) ||
00445                   L_bit_deposit_opcode (ptr) ||
00446                   (L_find_attr (ptr->attr, "do_not_split") != NULL))
00447                 continue;
00448 
00449               if (!L_in_oper_RIN_set (loop_back_br, ptr, dest) &&
00450                   L_in_oper_RIN_set (oper, ptr, dest))
00451                 L_remove_from_oper_RIN_set (oper, ptr, dest);
00452             }
00453         }
00454     }
00455 
00456   /*
00457    * Determine the set of instructions over which each definition
00458    * of a virtual register is live.
00459    */
00460   for (oper = pipe_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
00461     {
00462       int id = oper->id, is_pred_loopback;
00463       Set v_in = L_get_oper_IN_set (oper);
00464       Set v_out = NULL;
00465 
00466       is_pred_loopback = (oper == loop_back_br) && !oper->next_op &&
00467         L_is_predicated (oper) && L_has_fallthru_to_next_cb (pipe_cb);
00468 
00469       if (is_pred_loopback)
00470         v_out = L_get_oper_OUT_set (pipe_cb, oper, FALL_THRU_PATH);
00471 
00472       for (i = 0; i < numLpipeLiveRange; i++)
00473         {
00474           LpipeLiveRange *lr = LpipeLiveRanges[i];
00475           int vreg, vrid;
00476 
00477           vreg = lr->vreg;
00478           vrid = L_REG_INDEX (vreg);
00479 
00480           if ((Set_in (v_in, vrid) &&
00481                L_in_oper_RIN_set_reg (oper, lr->def_oper, vrid)) ||
00482               (is_pred_loopback && Set_in (v_out, vrid) &&
00483 #if 0
00484                L_in_oper_ROUT_set_reg (oper, lr->def_oper, vrid, 
00485                                        FALL_THRU_PATH)
00486 #else
00487               L_in_cb_RIN_set_reg (pipe_cb->next_cb, lr->def_oper, vrid)
00488 #endif
00489                ))
00490             {
00491               lr->op = Set_add (lr->op, oper->id);
00492               for (j = 0; j < L_max_src_operand; j++)
00493                 {
00494                   L_Operand *src = oper->src[j];
00495                   if (src && L_is_reg (src) && (src->value.r == vreg))
00496                     lr->ref_op = Set_add (lr->ref_op, id);
00497                 }
00498 
00499               /* If virtual register is live out of branch, add branch to
00500                  live_out_op set for live range.  Compensation code is
00501                  needed if this live range is renamed. */
00502               if (L_cond_branch_opcode (oper) ||
00503                   L_uncond_branch_opcode (oper))
00504                 {
00505                   int no_fallthru =
00506                     L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (pipe_cb->flags,
00507                                        L_CB_HYPERBLOCK_NO_FALLTHRU);
00508                   if (oper != loop_back_br)
00509                     {
00510                       v_out = L_get_oper_OUT_set (pipe_cb, oper, 
00511                                                   TAKEN_PATH);
00512                       if (Set_in (v_out, vrid))
00513                         lr->live_out_op = Set_add (lr->live_out_op, id);
00514                     }
00515                   else if (!L_uncond_branch (oper) && !no_fallthru)
00516                     {
00517                       v_out = L_get_oper_OUT_set (pipe_cb, oper,
00518                                                   FALL_THRU_PATH);
00519                       if (Set_in (v_out, vrid))
00520                         lr->live_out_op = Set_add (lr->live_out_op, id);
00521                     }
00522                 }
00523             }
00524         }
00525     }
00526 #ifdef DEBUG_PIPE_RENAME
00527   fprintf (stdout, "*\n*\n Live Ranges Before Split\n *\n");
00528   for (i = 0; i < numLpipeLiveRange; i++)
00529     R_print_LpipeLiveRange (LpipeLiveRanges[i]);
00530 #endif
00531 
00532   /* 
00533    * Merge non-disjoint live ranges 
00534    */
00535 
00536   do
00537     {
00538       change = 0;
00539       for (i = 0; i < numLpipeLiveRange; i++)
00540         {
00541           Set isect;
00542           LpipeLiveRange *lr1 = LpipeLiveRanges[i];
00543 
00544           if (!lr1 || !lr1->valid)
00545             continue;
00546 
00547           for (j = i + 1; j < numLpipeLiveRange; j++)
00548             {
00549               LpipeLiveRange *lr2 = LpipeLiveRanges[j];
00550 
00551               if (!lr2 || !lr2->valid || (lr1->vreg != lr2->vreg))
00552                 continue;
00553 
00554               if (Set_intersect_empty (lr1->op, lr2->op))
00555                 continue;
00556 
00557 #if 1
00558               /* This appears to prevent the merging of infinite-lifetime
00559                * moves.  If the first half gets renamed, the predicated
00560                * write is re-exposed.  
00561                * This seems questionable at best.
00562                * JWS
00563                */
00564               if ((isect = Set_intersect (lr1->op, lr2->op)) &&
00565                   Set_size (isect) == 1)
00566                 {
00567                   int isect_op;
00568                   L_Oper *isect_oper;
00569 
00570                   Set_2array (isect, &isect_op);
00571                   isect_oper = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_oper (fn->oper_hash_tbl,
00572                                                           isect_op);
00573                   if (L_general_move_opcode (isect_oper) &&
00574                       L_same_operand (isect_oper->dest[0],
00575                                       isect_oper->src[0]))
00576                     continue;
00577                 }
00578 
00579               isect = Set_dispose (isect);
00580 #endif
00581 
00582 #ifdef DEBUG_PIPE_RENAME
00583               fprintf (stdout, "Merging Live Range %d %d\n",
00584                        lr1->vreg, lr2->vreg);
00585               Set_print (stdout, "lr1", lr1->op);
00586               Set_print (stdout, "lr2", lr2->op);
00587 #endif
00588               lr1->op = Set_union_acc (lr1->op, lr2->op);
00589               lr1->def_op = Set_union_acc (lr1->def_op, lr2->def_op);
00590               lr1->ref_op = Set_union_acc (lr1->ref_op, lr2->ref_op);
00591               lr1->live_out_op = Set_union_acc (lr1->live_out_op,
00592                                                 lr2->live_out_op);
00593 
00594               lr2->valid = 0;
00595               Set_dispose (lr2->op);
00596               Set_dispose (lr2->def_op);
00597               Set_dispose (lr2->ref_op);
00598               Set_dispose (lr2->live_out_op);
00599 
00600               change += 1;
00601             }
00602         }
00603       dest = -1;
00604       for (i = 0; i < numLpipeLiveRange; i++)
00605         {
00606           LpipeLiveRange *lr = LpipeLiveRanges[i];
00607 
00608           if (!lr)
00609             {
00610               continue;
00611             }
00612           else if (!lr->valid)
00613             {
00614               if (dest == -1)
00615                 dest = i;
00616               Lcode_free (lr);
00617               LpipeLiveRanges[i] = NULL;
00618             }
00619           else if (dest != -1)
00620             {
00621               LpipeLiveRanges[dest++] = LpipeLiveRanges[i];
00622               LpipeLiveRanges[i] = NULL;
00623             }
00624         }
00625     }
00626   while (change);
00627 
00628 #ifdef DEBUG_PIPE_RENAME
00629   fprintf (stdout, "*\n*\n Live Ranges After Merging\n *\n");
00630   for (i = 0; i < numLpipeLiveRange; i++)
00631     if (LpipeLiveRanges[i])
00632       R_print_LpipeLiveRange (LpipeLiveRanges[i]);
00633 #endif
00634 
00635   vrarray =
00636     (LpipeLiveRange **) calloc (fn->max_reg_id + 1,
00637                                 sizeof (LpipeLiveRange *));
00638   oparray = (int *) malloc ((fn->max_oper_id + 1) * sizeof (int));
00639 
00640 #ifdef DEBUG_PIPE_RENAME
00641   fprintf (stdout, "Starting disj vreg renaming.\n");
00642 #endif
00643 
00644   /* 
00645    * Rename disjoint virtual registers with the same 
00646    * virtual register id.
00647    */
00648   for (i = 0; i < numLpipeLiveRange; i++)
00649     {
00650       int old_vreg, vreg, num_op;
00651       LpipeLiveRange *temp_lr;
00652       LpipeLiveRange *lr = LpipeLiveRanges[i];
00653 
00654       if (!lr)
00655         break;
00656 
00657       /* vrarray[lr->vreg] equal to 0 indicates that a live range with name
00658          vreg has not been seen before.  If vrarray[lr->vreg] is not 0,
00659          then it is a pointer to previously processed live range with the 
00660          same name. */
00661       if (!vrarray[lr->vreg])
00662         {
00663           vrarray[lr->vreg] = lr;
00664           continue;
00665         }
00666 
00667       /* If current live range contains the loop back branch, rename the
00668          earlier live range.  If current live range does not contain the 
00669          loop back branch, rename the current live range. */
00670       if (Set_in (lr->op, loop_back_br->id))
00671         {
00672           temp_lr = vrarray[lr->vreg];
00673           vrarray[lr->vreg] = lr;
00674           lr = temp_lr;
00675         }
00676 
00677       old_vreg = lr->vreg;
00678       vreg = ++(fn->max_reg_id);
00679 
00680       if (Lpipe_debug >= 2)
00681         fprintf (stdout, "Renaming %d (def op %d) -> %d\n",
00682                  old_vreg, lr->def_oper->id, vreg);
00683 
00684       /*
00685        * Loop through defining operations 
00686        */
00687       num_op = Set_2array (lr->def_op, oparray);
00688       for (j = 0; j < num_op; j++)
00689         {
00690           L_Oper *oper = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_oper (fn->oper_hash_tbl,
00691                                                     oparray[j]);
00692 
00693           /* rename all registers in ill_reg attributes SYH 9/24/96 */
00694           ill_reg = oper->attr;
00695           while ((ill_reg = L_find_attr (ill_reg, "ill_reg")))
00696             {
00697               if (ill_reg && ill_reg->field[0]->value.i == old_vreg)
00698                 ill_reg->field[0]->value.i = vreg;
00699               ill_reg = ill_reg->next_attr;
00700             }
00701 
00702           for (k = 0; k < L_max_dest_operand; k++)
00703             {
00704               L_Operand *dest;
00705               if (!(dest = oper->dest[k]))
00706                 continue;
00707               if (L_is_reg (dest) && dest->value.r == old_vreg)
00708                 {
00709                   dest->value.r = vreg;
00710 #ifdef DEBUG_PIPE_RENAME
00711                   fprintf (stdout, "op %d: dst reg %d -> %d\n",
00712                            oper->id, old_vreg, vreg);
00713 #endif
00714                 }
00715             }
00716         }
00717 
00718       /* 
00719        * Loop through referencing operations
00720        */
00721       num_op = Set_2array (lr->ref_op, oparray);
00722       for (j = 0; j < num_op; j++)
00723         {
00724           L_Oper *oper = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_oper (fn->oper_hash_tbl,
00725                                                     oparray[j]);
00726 
00727           /* rename all registers in ill_reg attributes SYH 9/24/96 */
00728           ill_reg = oper->attr;
00729           while ((ill_reg = L_find_attr (ill_reg, "ill_reg")))
00730             {
00731               if (ill_reg && ill_reg->field[0]->value.i == old_vreg)
00732                 ill_reg->field[0]->value.i = vreg;
00733               ill_reg = ill_reg->next_attr;
00734             }
00735 
00736           for (k = 0; k < L_max_src_operand; k++)
00737             {
00738               L_Operand *src;
00739               if ((src = oper->src[k]) &&
00740                   (L_is_reg (src)) && (src->value.r == old_vreg))
00741                 {
00742                   src->value.r = vreg;
00743 #ifdef DEBUG_PIPE_RENAME
00744                   fprintf (stdout, "op %d: src reg %d -> %d\n",
00745                            oper->id, old_vreg, vreg);
00746 #endif
00747                 }
00748             }
00749         }
00750 
00751       /*  Loop through branches for which live range is live out and add
00752          compensation code. */
00753       num_op = Set_2array (lr->live_out_op, oparray);
00754       for (j = 0; j < num_op; j++)
00755         {
00756           L_Operand *src, *dest;
00757           L_Oper *oper = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_oper (fn->oper_hash_tbl,
00758                                                     oparray[j]);
00759           if (oper != loop_back_br)
00760             {
00761               comp_cb = L_find_branch_dest (oper);
00762 
00763               src = L_new_register_operand (vreg, lr->ctype, L_PTYPE_NULL);
00764               dest =
00765                 L_new_register_operand (old_vreg, lr->ctype, L_PTYPE_NULL);
00766               new_oper = Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (dest, src);
00767               /* make sure move goes before jump at end of block */
00768               L_insert_oper_before (comp_cb, comp_cb->first_op, new_oper);
00769               L_annotate_oper (fn, comp_cb, new_oper);
00770               L_delete_oper (comp_cb, new_oper);
00771             }
00772         }
00773     }
00774 
00775 #ifdef DEBUG_PIPE_RENAME
00776   fprintf (stdout, "Done with disj vreg renaming.\n");
00777 #endif
00778 
00779   Lcode_free (vrarray);
00780   Lcode_free (oparray);
00781 
00782   for (i = 0; i < numLpipeLiveRange; i++)
00783     {
00784       LpipeLiveRange *lr = LpipeLiveRanges[i];
00785 
00786       if (!lr)
00787         break;
00788 
00789       Set_dispose (lr->op);
00790       Set_dispose (lr->def_op);
00791       Set_dispose (lr->ref_op);
00792       Set_dispose (lr->live_out_op);
00793       Lcode_free (lr);
00794       LpipeLiveRanges[i] = NULL;
00795     }
00796 
00797   Lcode_free (LpipeLiveRanges);
00798 
00799   return;
00800 }
Generated on Sat Aug 30 17:59:22 2014 for libsoftpipe by  1.4.7
